response:
Urgent MRI is the gold standard to differentiate between demyelination (MS plaques), ischaemia (infarction), and structural lesions (tumour) in the posterior fossa. Vascular imaging is essential to exclude vertebral artery dissection. CSF analysis supports the diagnosis of inflammatory or infectious etiologies.
